sen.j: 竹屋町通（たけやまちどおり）は京都市内の東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Takeyamachi-dori Street is an east-west running street of Kyoto City.
The Takeyamachi-dori Street is a street running east-west through Kyoto City.
The Takeyamachi-dori Street is a street running east-west through Kyoto City.

sen.j: 東は平安神宮西端の桜馬場通から西は千本通まで。
sen.e: It extends from the western edge of Heian Jingu Shrine on the Sakuranobanba-dori Street in the east to the Senbon-dori Street in the west.
It extends from the western edge of Heian Jingu Shrine on Sakuranobanba-dori Street in the east to Senbon-dori Street in the west.
It extends from the western edge of Heian-jingu Shrine on Sakuranobanba-dori Street in the east to Senbon-dori Street in the west.

sen.j: 途中鴨川 (淀川水系)を挟む川端通と土手町通の間で分断されている。
sen.e: It is divided between the Kawabata-dori Street and the Dotemachi-dori Street across the Kamo River (the Yodo River water system).
It is divided between Kawabata-dori Street and Dotemachi-dori Street across Kamo River (the Yodo River water system).
It is divided between Kawabata-dori Street and Dotemachi-dori Street across Kamo-gawa River (the Yodo-gawa River water system).
sen.cmt: Kamo-gawa River, Yodo-gawa Riverとしました。

sen.j: また土手町通と寺町通の間ではやや南にずれている。
sen.e: The section between the Dotemachi-dori Street and the Teramachi-dori Street deviates slightly south.
The section between Dotemachi-dori Street and Teramachi-dori Street deviates slightly south.
The section between Dotemachi-dori Street and Teramachi-dori Street deviates slightly south.

sen.j: 丸太町通の一本南にあたり、二条城の北端を通っている。
sen.e: It runs a block south of the Marutamachi-dori Street and passes along the northern edge of the Nijo Castle.
It runs a block south of Marutamachi-dori Street and passes along the northern edge of Nijo Castle.
It runs a block south of Marutamachi-dori Street and passes along the northern edge of Nijo-jo Castle.

sen.j: 鴨川から東は東竹屋町通と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: Some may call the section east of the Kamo River Higashi Takeyamachi-dori Street.
Some may call the section east of Kamo River Higashi Takeyamachi-dori Street.
Some may call the section east of Kamo-gawa River Higashi Takeyamachi-dori Street.

sen.j: 平安京の大炊御門大路（おおいのみかどおおじ）にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Oinomikadooji of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Oinomikadooji of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Oinomikadooji of Heiankyo.

sen.j: 江戸時代には職人の町として知られた。
sen.e: During the Edo era the area along the street is known as a district of craftsmen.
During the Edo era the area along the street was known as a district of craftsmen.
During the Edo period the area along the street was known as a district of craftsmen.

sen.j: 寺町通との交差点の東に行願寺（革堂）がある。
sen.e: Gyogan-ji Temple (Kodo) is located east of the crossing with the Teramachi-dori Street.
Gyogan-ji Temple (Kodo) is located east of the intersection with Teramachi-dori Street.
Gyogan-ji Temple (Kodo) is located east of the intersection with Teramachi-dori Street.
